articles.content: New Delhi: The trajectory of COVID-19 cases could have plateaued and might even fall for some weeks after the lockdown is lifted but India is likely to see a second wave in late July or August with a surge in the number of cases during the monsoon, say scient… [+6186 chars]

articles.title: Nearly all patients hospitalised with Covid-19 had chronic health issues, study finds - TODAYonline
articles.description: NEW YORK — A new study of thousands of hospitalised coronavirus patients in the New York City area, the epicenter of the outbreak in the United States, has found that nearly all of them had at least one major chronic health condition, and most — 88 per cent —…

articles.author: Whitney Woodworth Salem Statesman Journal
articles.title: Oregon State University researcher: Vitamins C, D can help prevent COVID-19 - KGW.com
articles.description: This is not new science, the role nutrition plays in supporting the immune system is well-established.
articles.content:
CORVALLIS, Ore. Supplements containing vitamins C and D, along with other micronutrients, can be a "safe, effective and low-cost" means to fight off COVID-19 and other acute respiratory tract diseases, according to an Oregon State University researcher.
